arcade.patch.env.location

Class PatchLocation

  • java.lang.Object
    • arcade.patch.env.location.PatchLocation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Location
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PatchLocationHex, PatchLocationRect

    public abstract class PatchLocation
extends java.lang.Object
implements Location
    Abstract implementation of Location for patch models.

    PatchLocation objects define where agents are within the Grid (relative to other agents) and relative to the Lattice (local molecule concentrations). Thecoordinate defines the location in the Grid while the term subcoordinate(s) defines the location(s) in the Lattice.

    There may be multiple subcoordinates associated with the same coordinate (therefore there may be more than one agent per coordinate, but there can only be one agent for a given coordinate / subcoordinate pair). For example, in the hexagonal grid, each hexagon has a coordinate. Within each hexagon there are six corresponding triangular lattice subcoordinates. There may be multiple agents in a given hexagon, but each cell within that hexagon is associated with a specific unique triangle. Therefore, there can be no more than six agents per hexagonal patch.

    Regardless of geometry, the center of the model should have Grid location coordinate (0,0,0) or (0,0,0,0). Lattice arrays cannot have negative indices, so (0,0,0) is located at the top left of the 2D array and the bottom layer of the 3D stack.
